intro: Eriosema muxiria, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant features trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces, contributing to its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Eriosema muxiria is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
